Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lori M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a park/sleep/fly package before leaving out of Sea-Tac. What they don't mention is that there airport shuttle doesn't run 24 hours a day. We had an 8:00 flight on a Saturday morning and the shuttle didn't start until 7:00 am. We had to get a taxi to take us to the airport. Afterward I emailed to see about getting that reimbursed. Never heard back. Won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good South Seattle Motel”
Reviews.Author: TravlinNole
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel between Seattle Airport & downtown. Rooms are clean & well-appointed with a king size bed, fridge, microwave & large TV. Convienent to I-5. Only major complaint was the breakfast bar was in bad shape when I arrived @ 9 a.m. No waffle batter, regular coffee, or milk in addition to a poor selection of most other items. Pedro, the front desk clerk, didn't give a damn about service or anything else. Other than that, this is a good choice for a budget motel in South Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Non smoker charged with smoking-fraudulent charges being pursued”
Reviews.Author: aisha m
Reviews.Content: they falsely charged my debit card for smoking in a non smoking room $100. I do not smoke . So many things were wrong with this room, the last available room due to a bad snow storm but the front desk clerk was "clueless." The phone cord had to be held in if making a call, lamp didnt work, and the front desk button didnt work, & the shelf was hanging from the wall. Ive had to file a claim with my bank to get my deposit that was supposed to be $50 but they charged $100 back, and will pursue them in court for falsely accuming me of smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: alreadyinuse
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Even under the bed. Friendly staff. Nice breakfast and good coffee all day in the lobby. Internet access at two computers in lobby, but they are s l o w! The coffee provided with the coffee maker in room is pretty nasty. Microwave and fridge. I wish they had a table and chairs in the room, but otherwise, for the price I think it was a good, basic room close to freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget motel right outside Seattle”
Reviews.Author: suznjay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Seattle for our 6th wedding anniversary. We reviewed serveral budget hotels in Seattle and were able to stay 2 nights at this location for the price of 1 night if we had stayed in the city. It's 10 minutes from downtown, right off the freeway. My only complaint was the pillows were horrible, so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Poor first imprressions.”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked into Room 110 for 2 nights. Only one light/lamp worked and TV was out of order. Called front desk and they sent someone to fix everything. TV still had some issues on ocassion. WiFi signal was week and cut out alot of times. This is a very busy property so don't expect early check-in. Pretty convenient to freeways and the motel sits up the street from a Starbucks and gas stations.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: js945
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were on vacation when we stayed here. She picked this one out and I was skeptical because I have only stayed at Days Inn once before (it was in Hollywood; haven't reviewed it). Anyway, We made two separate reservations. She made hers for two nights via CheapTickets and I made mine for one night via the Days Inn website (we made the two night res. a month in advance and decided to make it a three night stay the night before we left for Seattle). Via CheapTickets, we paid about $55/night. I happen to find a promo code for the res. I made, so it was taken from a rate of $75 down to $50. Ok, so we arrived at the motel, and it is extremely close to the freeway, which didn't bother us (might bother some others though). The man at the front desk (forgot to get his name, sorry) seemed very apathetic to us and the people before us. However, the checkin was smooth and he paired both of the reservations together so we didn't have to change rooms. We got our keys and went to our room. Little did I realize, a mistake was made when I made the res. on the website and we ended up with a smoking room. Seeing how I am allergic to tobacco, this was definitely NOT acceptable. We immediately went back to the front desk and again, the man was very apathetic. To my surprise, he upgraded our room from what was a first floor single queen smoking room to a king non smoking second floor poolside room FOR FREE. MUCH MUCH better. The only bummer is that we had to switch rooms in the morning to a single queen non smoking, but that was ok for us. Our room was nice. There were 5 pillows on the bed, and the bed itself was very soft and comfortable. All the basic amenities were there (soap, shampoo, cups, towels, etc.). Everything was clean and worked well. We had a great nights sleep, even with the window open! The next morning we ate the continental breakfast. They offered waffles (used waffle mix and a waffle iron), 2 different muffin flavors, toast, English muffins, four flavors of cereal, milk, coffee, OJ, and apple juice. We found apples the first morning, but not the next two... so my guess is that they are limited every morning. Also, the breakfast room attendant seemed very annoyed (though,I can understand when one guy didn't read the directions and failed to spray the waffle iron before use). After we ate, we went to the front desk to check about having to switch rooms. This time, there was a girl named Nadia. She was much more pleasant than the man that checked us in. Anyway, she said to us, and these were her exact words, "Why would you need to change rooms? Your reservation is already paid for. You can just stay in that room." Thus, we got to keep the king room for the next two nights. Accommodated? YES! We were very happy about the situation. Moving on. The motel does have an airport shuttle, but we didn't use it, so I cannot comment on that. We also didn't use the pool/hot tub. Free WiFi is available, but the signal was very week. We didn't complain about... we were able to check the important things just fine. As for location, the airport is about an 10 minute drive away. The nearest light rail station is an 8 minute drive (though it takes upwards of an hour to get downtown). The Seattle Flight Museum is an 8 minute drive away. And there is a large mall that takes about 10 minutes to get to. One thing I did notice is that the Housekeepers start working at 8AM. We put our privacy sign on the entire time, and on our final morning, the housekeeper knocked just after 8. I thought to myself, "Maybe she thought we had checked out already." After getting up and dressed, we came to find out that our sign had gone missing. We think that some other guests had taken it, but we'll never know. Overall, it was a nice motel. I rate it a 4/5. I think I would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: wian555
Reviews.Content: We paid 62$ + tax for this room and I was scared after reading some reviews on this site. The room was small, but OK. Smelled like incense was burned in the room. Nice pool, super hot tub, could print stuff for free, good WI-FI, descent breakfast, etc. For the price paid, almost excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Gravity259
Reviews.Content: I opted for this hotel as my known and looked hotels were unavailable for my dates. Just booking the room online was troublesome. Wanted park and fly, followed the site's instructions of how to book, and was informed on arrival $25 more needed for parking. This after calling to verify at time of booking. Oh well, flight is soon, had good shuttle to Seatac. On return trip, despite putting note in original booking, and conversation with front desk on initial arrival, I called Days Inn for ride from airport, at 1 am as noted. Informed shuttle doesn't run after 11 pm! $20 more for taxi. Met with stale room adjacent to freeway, shower only functional because I have overhauled plumbing before, and knew how to hack it enough to deliver water. Left ASAP, found breakfast downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl78
Reviews.Content: Will def stay here again! Staff was always friendly. Made reservations for 2 nights, staff was very accomadating when we needed to stay an extra night and gave us the same rate. Convienient location to gas stations and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tommy013
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a king bed and found the bed to be very comfortable. The room was clean and - unexpectedly - decorated with a bunch of zebra kitsch. There was a zebra head sticking out of the wall above the sofa. It was hilarious in a fun sort of way. We didn't find the room to be noisy at all. It was off-season for the pool so I can't comment on that. Staff were friendly and helpful. There used to be a restaurant a few buildings away from the Inn but it is no longer in business. There was some sort of coffee place and a fast food joint within 2 minutes' walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Utmost in professional staff”
Reviews.Author: mjjgreisen
Reviews.Content: Sean and Nadia, desk clerks, handle both routine and challenging events with matter of fact politeness and appropriate response. The entire staff is freindly and supportive beyond measure. I feel happy and secure in the environment they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Money”
Reviews.Author: angelbear425
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was honestly worried about staying at this hotel, but oncce I got there my fears were calmed and I had a great stay. My flight landed early and I was able to check in early (4 hours). The room was basic (bed, chair, desk, flat screen tv, dresser), but comfortable. The bathroom area had granite countertops. It was clean and, for the amount of time I actually spent in the room, a good value for the money. My room opened up to the pool, but being April in Seattle wasn't open. The highway was noisy, however once I turned on the heating unit you could not hear the noise anymore. I do recommend turning on the heat/fan/AC unit if you are a lighter sleeper. The bed was fine (not too hard/not too soft) and the water pressue in the shower was average for a shower. One good thing about the shower was that it was a massaging head with many different pressure settings. Housekeeping arrived early each day I was there and I usually wasn't ready for her to clean the room (I wasn't even ready to leave yet), but every night when I arrived back at the hotel my bed was made up and there were clean towels in the room. I was only able to have breakfast 2 of the days I was there (didn't wake up early enough the other 2 days), which was a basic continental breakfast with the added benefit of waffles. My only complaint the whole time I was there was a staff member, named carol, on my final morning at breakfast. Someone couldn't read the directions on how to use the waffle maker (spray first, pour batter, close and turn until it beeps) and the waffle stuck in the iron. Carol was standing there cleaning it, but quite a few people were waiting to use it so we were standing around. She turns to us and goes "It's going to take awhile, do you have to stand there?" and someone else answers that we did need to stand there. So every so often while she was cleaning she would turn and smirk, sigh loudly, and shade her head. She kept doing this for a good 15 minutes while cleaning the entire area and not allowing anyone to use the waffle irons (15 minutes before breakfast was over). Finally she decided she was finished and started making waffles for people.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: PG_Coach
Reviews.Content: I ordered this hotel through a B & B booking website, and I was very disappointed. The hotel was just off the freeway which meant that it was noisy the whole time. A positive was that it was very close to a great running trail if you run, and near a Starbucks and other little restaurants. Now the fun part. The room was very dirty and there was a very strong urine smell in the room. My guess is that the cleaners do not do a thorough job cleaning the toilet seat lid, which is quite common. As someone who manages property I know the problem. Also on one of the nights we were there a rude guest cut us off then proceeded to take a picture of our license plate. Not a nice feeling at all. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, etc!”
Reviews.Author: woodie154943
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next to I5 highway and the traffic noise was terrible...non stop all night. I used ear plugs and still had trouble sleeping. My spouse had no ear plugs and could hardly sleep at all. The door to the room did not fit the door sill properly and there were openings around the door, allowing more noise to enter the room. The bathroom had been upgraded and was fine, but the room , furniture ,tv, were dated and run down looking.For our purpose of staying one night before we flew out, it was barely tolerable,although the room rate was reasonable. There are no restaurants any where nearby, although we finally found a pub, after driving around for awhile, and had a great pizza. On our return one week later to pick up our car, as it was a stay and park arrangement, we discovered that the location they use for long term parking is directly under a row of trees, which deposited their needles and leaves all over our car. It took us 30 minutes to clean the car so we could drive home. We had to go to a nearby gas station to hose it off before we could proceed. We were not happy about this. All in all, not a pleasant stay at his hotel, and we will not return. Robert Wood O

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked. Many better options nearby..”
Reviews.Author: travelover69
Reviews.Content: So I check in around 10pm or so, and the "manager" was working. I had booked a very cheap room online because of my travel benefits. I'm assuming that because of this, the manager gave me the sh!tiest room in the hotel. The bed sagged bigtime, there was hair in the drain, the previous guests used soap was still in the shower, toilet ran all night, the carpet had crap stains on it, highway noise all night, yucky coffee in the morning. Horrible!! I was tired from traveling so I didn't complain, and just called it a night. Woke up the next morning with back pain of course. I asked if I could get a shuttle to a place about a mile down the street. The front desk clerk gave me some crap about insurance only allowing them to go to the airport and back. Spend the extra $15 bucks and go to the Best Western River's Edge up the street! Much much better service and facilities than this place. The staff here at Days Inn didn't even seem to appreciate our business. Mr Dhillon, hire a new manager!

Reviews.Title: “In a word NASTY!!”
Reviews.Author: lady_duvall
Reviews.Content: I understand that we stayed here on the VA's dime and we had a smoking room but the service was bad, and the room was disgusting. The floor was sticky, the nightstand was sticky, the bathtub was grungy, and there was blood on the bathroom wall. I don't know what the crusty stuff was on the wall; I don't think i want to know, The sheets didn't fit not to mention they were put on inside out. There was nicotine stains running down the wall. A light went out in the bathroom the first night we were there, the shower head had brown crusty stuff caked on it. Electricity went out for about 10 min the day we were checking out. I am talking to the VA about removing this dump off of the lodging list, a vet deserves better. Anyone deserves better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated park-and-fly hotel at premium prices”
Reviews.Author: traveler46_10
Reviews.Content: My son and I were attracted by the advertised $89 park-and-fly rate (1 night + 1 week parking). In fact, he rate increases to $119 when we factored in the current date after reading the fine print. The hotel does not give AAA discounts for park-and-fly. When we arrived, we found the hotel was run-down and doubled as a truck stop. The Indian family running the business are using it as a cash machine. If you need to print something at the business center, paper is 25 cents per sheet. The hotel location is a stone's throw from Interstate 5 and extremely noisy. Single-pane windows and gaps in the door let in all the noise and fumes. Other guests use the walk-up balcony as a drinking and smoking lounge. Although we only stayed a single night, it was long enough to discover that the hot water works only intermittently, breakfast is mediocre, the airport shuttle only operates during limited hours and times, and the neighborhood is not the kind you stroll at night.

Reviews.Title: “Godd budget hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: JayD2006
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel conveniently located, close to the airport with easy access to Seattle. A free shuttle to the airport is offered along with free internet and free Bkf. Staff was professional and helpful. There is a swimming pool which my kids enjoyed. Breakfast was OK. The only issue is its location close to I-5 with very noisy traffic, but the room has a good isolation, so we had a good night sleep without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “pick a different place!”
Reviews.Author: cuin5
Reviews.Content: in a word - awful ! no staff to help - the poor girl in front was doing EVERYTHING - computer printer did not work - but no sign saying so - noisy noisy freeway beside - in an isolated area with nothing around for eating,etc. beds are from another era - could say more, but you get the picture? shuttle to airport is driven by whoever is handy - waiting at airport for 40 minutes and then having to listen to LOUD rap music all the way back - the girl driving seemed unfamiliar with the route or van . It was the "icing on the cake !" - use your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: 2010BB
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a good location for Seatac airport and the shuttle bus is good. Staff should inform people that the Seatac airport departure bay provides a free phone link to the hotel to call the shuttle bus (noticed this when on the bus already). Too bad the restaurant next door to the hotel has closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in late September. The room was average for a budget hotel, but the hotel is right next to I-405 and the traffic noise never stopped all night long. The hvac unit could not drown out the noise. I guess that is why the rates are so attractive. The room had a desk and 2 chairs. It could use a small table. The room had a 27" flat screen tv with 80+ channels. There are good resturantes about 5 minutes away. The breakfast was average with waffles, fruit, muffins, pastry, hot and cold cereal, juice, and coffee. The hotel has easy access to both I-405 and I-5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Low-Cost Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: The Days is a nice affordable lodging option located on I-5 and Interurban. Based on what others have said, maybe it is an airport hotel although I would never know that being as that my approach led to no indication of an airport nearby. Despite it being right off of the interstate, the road noise is decently muffled due in part to the trees that line the property. The rooms are what you would expect of a Days Inn. Not too large, not too small. Not plush, but clean and functional. It's got a tv and fridge... I'm good to go. There is free internet and free breakfast in the office lobby. Within 15 minutes of any direction, you can easily come upon supermarkets, restaurants, shopping centers, and the ubiquitous coffee shacks that make Seattle well, Seattle. Southcenter mall is also not too far away. So if you come with Hyatt expectations, then yes you will be disappointed. But for what it is, you can't be wrong. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: prissy10
Reviews.Content: For $53 a night we got a clean room, large vanity counter, spotless bathroom, great TV and friendly staff. Left too early to try the coffee or breakfast. There is a Quiznos just down the street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie03
Reviews.Content: Spacious breakfast area. Located right next to a major highway.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than What I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: vYrb
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this Days Inn. I thought it was going to be a run down hotel but to my surprise it wasn't. It had a budget rate but I had a 3 star. Rooms very clean. No odor was lingering. Bathroom very clean, nice amenities. Hot breakfast was served. There was a computer to use in the lobby with printer. Only thing was that I wish meat was served with breakfast. Other than that I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We miss Seattle... and the Days Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: shonenknife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the middle of September on a 4-day trip to Seattle. I believe the hotel you stay at kind of shapes your vacation more than anything else, and the Days Inn really did that. I was very skeptical of the hotel after paying less than a premier price and reading some shifty reviews. I mean, it's not a 5-star $300/night hotel, but it was a great little place to stay. The continental breakfast was very good... I craved the waffles for days after I got back home. The staff was also very accommodating. My wife is pregnant and got sick while we were there off some bad Chinese food. I asked the receptionist where the closest hospital was, just in case, and she pulled out a pre-printed mapquest map to the hospital and give it to us for free. Later on, on a whim I asked them if there was a Wal-Mart nearby, and she pulled out yet another mapquest map to the Wal-Mart and gave us that for free!!! The cleaning lady came in and cleaned our room every day while we were gone and did a fantastic job without disturbing the possessions we left in the room (we have bad experiences of our stuff being stolen by the cleaning crews of other hotels). Their parking is very accommodating, and they have a nice lounge in the breakfast area with a computer with internet access and a big TV. They also have a pool which doesn't look too inviting, but it was the fall when we stayed so maybe the 60-degree weather didn't put us in the pool mood. We will be returning to Seattle, and we will definitely consider the Tukwila Days Inn first.

Reviews.Title: “Pig Pin Dumpest I Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: unreal99
Reviews.Content: IT the filthest place i ever been in paid 3 nights on line checked in left 5 minutes later and paid for 3 more nights in another hotel this is a no brainer very bad bad bad

Reviews.Title: “whatch it cause they'll screw ya!!”
Reviews.Author: rachie_skltn
Reviews.Content: First of all the place was a dump but my husband and i already paid for the roomin advance for 5 days. the room didn't get cleaned until the day before we left, We had to go to the front office ourselves to get extra trash bags and stop the cleaning lady while outside smoking for clean towels. Oh if you are a smoker i would suggest to just leave your cigarette butts on the ground outside because we tried to do the right thing and put them in the garbage can inside the room, but instead they debited our account $100 because the room smelled like cigarettes. When i talked to the manager a day later he said "basically it's too bad because theres nothing that can be done, it smelled like it to the cleaning lady therefore you must have smoked in the room" . Their word against ours basically. The only other people that stay there are the workers, so they have to get there money somehow huh?... I will never stay there again and I wouldn't suggest anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for shopping”
Reviews.Author: karn143
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have stayed here and its great! its very close to the southcenter mall and there were many resturaunts in the area. The staff was very friendly and told me how to get where. The lobby computers were convenient to find more info about the area. the room was very clean and spacious. They would've given more towels, but i called the front desk and they sent them right up. i think this was a great hotel for the price. i reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “It is a Dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller57Illinois
Reviews.Content: The internet site and pictures are misleading. It is an old hotel that is in the middle of an industrial area. Interstate I-5 is close as is a crane hire company, a large trucking company yard and to add a little more noise a Harley motorbike dealer. Did not feel safe there, especially at night. To top it off in the morning 2 police cars, thought they had come for a free dough nut, but no they had been called for a problem. Other guests included workers on a construction project, and it seemed a large number of homeless war vets. Rooms ok, bit not great. Breakfast crowded and closed before the stated time due to running out of food. I would not stay there again, spend the extra 20 dollars and go closer to the airport. Expedia shows this as a 2 star hotel, it deserves a 1/2 star. I did not stay at the Days Inn at Seatac, but I think it would be a much better choice for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Park-Stay-Fly Choice”
Reviews.Author: I82X73
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through Park-Sleep-Fly in order to have free parking for the week we were on our trip, so this was a convenience stay more than anything else. There is nothing fancy about the place, as would be expected with this chain, but it was clean, relatively quiet (even though it is next to the I-5 freeway) and seemed pretty secure. The check-in staff was courteous and helpful. The shuttle to the airport takes about 10 minutes. Breakfast selections are limited though they do have waffles. There is a restaurant next door (we did not use) and two drive-in restaurants within a block. The hotel is in a light industrial area where crime does not seem to be a problem. Our vehicle was unmolested during the week it was parked at the hotel. Our only minor difficulty was in getting the shuttle to pick us up at the airport on our return since the front desk clerk did not see we had reservations. I had to explain that we had stayed there and that our car was parked there for them to send a shuttle -- we then ahd to wait for 30 minutes at 8 PM in the evening for our ride to come.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: TrancePixie
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this place are very deceiving. This was the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. Upon arrival we did get to check in about an hour before 3 pm which was convenient, however we arrived to a 2nd floor room which stank of musty alcohol and cigarrete smoke. The door had been kicked in by someone previously and the room number was broken off and written on with a black marker. The carpet was so filthy that my family and I wore shoes the hole entire time we were there. The carpet had been replaced...over the old carpet and the door to the adjacent room was not accessible because the new carpet was tacked over the bottom of the door, rendering it useless to try to open it. We arrived to hair on the toilet seat and in the bathtub, not enough towels and beds that looked unkept, smelled like someone had slept in them before. There was a little sign about the environment and the fact that they do not wash the sheets unless you put that little sign on the bed. So maybe the sheets hadn't been washed in a while? We were without hot water for the first 3 days out of 4 that we stayed there. My husband called the front desk or went down there to talk to them personally several times. They told him that they would try to switch us rooms or would fix the hot water if we came back the next day by 11 am. Ok, our main purpose to come to Seattle was to sight see. We were not aiming to wait around the hotel room all morning or to mess with moving between rooms. We were up and out of there before 8 o'clock each day and the hotel should have been the last thing on our agenda. They would not switch us rooms, kept saying that they didn't have any openings. After begging for hot water, they sent a maintenance man to our room that did not speak English. He came to our room 2 mornings in a row and still didn't manage to fix the hot water. Finally the 2nd night my husband called the general manager. He finally let us use the room adjacent to ours so that we could bathe ourselves and 4 children. The room key to the room next to us did not work and of course the carpet was tacked against the door so we couldn't go between the rooms from the inside. Finally my husband had to take the door off the hinges so that we could access the room just to take a sodding shower. Towels. Only once did housekeeping come to clean the room and give us towels..they left 3 towels, didn't change the sheets and we ended up having to take out our own garbage the whole time we were there...3 towels...for 6 people??, the rest of the time we had to beg the front desk for towels and got nasty attitude every time. I have yet to see the "fitness center". I do not believe it exists. The pool was freezing cold and dirty. The hot tub had soggy food strewn around it and the paint on the fences was peeling off. The switch to turn the hot tub on was not labeled and was right smack dab next to a general sign that pointed to all the switches that read..."Do not touch, Emergency shut off switch". So which switch exactly turns the darn thing on? The business center exists of two outdated computers on a counter in the lobby, one of which has a scribbled "out of order" sign on it. The only nice things was the free do it yourself waffles for continental breakfast if you can stomach sitting in a small lobby with tons of other guests and eating on sticky table clothes. At least we had friendly neighbors in the room next door to ours, they partied, cussed, drank and smoke until around 4 am the first night we were there. It was a real pain in the arse actually to have to listen to that all night long through the thin walls. NOISE. If you stay here you are within 50 feet of nothing but truck stops and a convenience store. There are no grocery stores anywhere near this place and one Jack in the Box restaurant. The freeway is within spitting distance of the back side of the hotel. If a car went over the guard rail it would probably land in the pool you're so close to I-5. So yes the website is accurate you are within close distance to the freeway. This was the WORST hotel experience we have ever had and will NEVER stay at this place again. Do yourself a favor and look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ilasmarie
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the first room was that it was clean; door would shut properly, we were right by Interstate 5, noise was constant all night long - unable to sleep - asked to be moved. Second night was strange - doors again would not lock properly, shut door with another person inside, without chain lock on, was able to just push door open and walk in! Mattresses were covered with heavy plastic - unable to sleep because of "crinkling" all night long. Complained to management - was told had to fumigate rooms on bottom floors because of "bugs brought by Easteners" so covered all mattresses! Would not have even slept there had we known. Suggest that AAA remove this motel from all its referral sights. Motel needs to be torn down!!! and Soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not even consider this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nnkd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. We stayed here in 2004 and it was ok for the price. Now it is positively disgusting. We asked for a non smoking room and got a smoking room that smelled terrible like pets and smoke. At the front desk do not speak to Navi she was rude and has zero personality to be in customer service. This hotel needs to be closed and revamped. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laciloo
Reviews.Content: I lost $340.00. My husband and I checked in and 10 minute later check out. Had reserved non smoking, got a smoking room awful smelling room!!! Lock on door did not work. Air condition did not work. Staff is rude and would not refund my money. I-5 is right outside the bedroom window. Days Inn Corporation should be ashamed for this Hotel using the Days Inn name. We ended up at Holiday Inn Express in Bothel which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Love2beTraveling
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't want to stay here again --- it's a little run down - the 2 non-smoking rooms both had an unpleasant odor. Rooms were clean, great water pressure and VERY hot water. Toilet seat made for a midget. Rooms have refrigerator and microwave. Breakfast was OK (they should be ashamed of the foul-tasting Folger's coffee they are serving in SEATTLE)! TINY area to eat in, and there's a sign telling you NOT to eat breakfast in your room. Had 2 rooms because there was no wireless Internet signal in the first one. Even in the 2nd, (closer to the lobby), the signal was weak, but usable. There's a sign at reception indicating you cannot use the free airport shuttle unless you sign up in advance. Then, they won't shuttle at all between the hours of 5-7am. And, outside those hours, the shuttle will run ONCE an HOUR! Lucky on this stay I have a rental car. I was going to stay again and use the shuttle, but have changed plans and will stay elsewhere. The back of the property is right up against I-5 and the traffic noise is 24x7 (although it didn't bother me). The front of the property is across from a YellowFreight trucking terminal so you've got the truck noise. And, the hotel is just a couple miles from Boeing Field and right on the approach to the runway - at about the point the aircraft have to gun the engines to stay airborne before landing --- and there are some LOUD military spy jets landing at Boeing field. This is a "budget" hotel and some of the guests didn't look like they could afford to be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cozywintersnow
Reviews.Content: The parking lot is rundown and dirty, completely unsecured. The front desk staff was unfriendly, seemed very bored and completely unwelcoming. The hallway my room was located in had two young men, dressed in street clothes, pushing the maid cart. I imagine they work there, but they had no nametags and spoke to each other in a foreign language. My room was smelly, the TV control did not work, the beds were hard, the pillows had stains on them, and the carpet was disgusting. I was almost afraid of sleeping there because I imagine the place full of those bed bugs they talk about on tv. I wanted a refund right away but couldn't get one because I booked through a low price site. Ugh!!! Never again!! I have learned my lesson!!!

Reviews.Title: “decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: getacloo
Reviews.Content: Overall a great stay for the price. I booked directly on the website because it had the cheapest price for a standard queen non-smoking room. I was impressed with the bathroom and overall cleanliness of the room although there were some stains on the carpet. The heating unit was also slow to start but after an hour or so it worked fine. Paid around $65 for new years eve and thought it was a great deal. Parking was easy to find and the hotel itself is right off the highway. I did not have trouble sleeping due to highway traffic and didn't even notice it until the next morning. Continental breakfast leaves a bit to be desired although the waffles looked good (didn't try any). I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a quick, cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hazelson
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. Spacious rooms, good location for our needs. There is a restaurant close by as well as a Jack In The Box. Breakfast in the lobby was really good - with the waffle maker and lots of juices to choose from. There was freeway noise but we had the air conditioning on so it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Billiam123
Reviews.Content: The AC was so ineffective ( would not cool the room) we were moved to another room. The bed was old and saggy. The pool and free breakfast were fine and the hosts friendly, but they seemed overworked (it was during a heat wave). Most important, the trash (papers and cigarette butts) was never cleaned from the ground areas while we were there. Compared to other low cost motels we used while on a six-week trip around the U.S., this gets - at best - two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the worst hole, oops i mean hotel I have ever stayed in. There was no hot water, the bed made it impossible to sleep, and I wasn't sure if i would get better customer service from the staff or the roaches that I saw.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PatfromKeizer
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the price at this hotel. On the positive side, there was a refrigerator, microwave, iron and ironing board in the room, all fairly new and in good working condition. The bathroom fixtures were new. The room was clean. There was a nice outdoor swimming pool and spa. They served a continental breakfast with coffee, juice, cereal and waffles. On the negative side, we paid for our room in advance, called the day of our arrival to confirm that we would have a late check-in, and arrived to find that our room had been canceled because we didn't check in early enough. The desk clerk had to search to see if a room was available for us, and luckily found one for us. The room was supposed to be a non-smoking room but the room smelled like cigarette smoke and something else that was used to try to cover up the odor. There were cigarette burn holes on the bedspread. The lamp on one side of the bed was broken, the television picture tube was going bad so the picture was fuzzy and spread out. The pillows on the bed were so puny that we used towels to "boost" them, the fan in the bathroom made a loud clanking noise, and the bed was so uncomfortable that we both woke up with backaches. We probably won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mwcurlee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for staying at before or after a cruise, we were only staying one day and the room was ready early and it was clean and they were helpful. If you need a shuttle at an after hours time you just have to call them and they will take care of it! It's way better than the Best Value Inn in Renton! I would stay here a again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel, nice lobby, clean room and a nice breakfast. I was in the area house hunting and stayed at this place for 3 weeks. The housekeeper did a wonderful job every day and I paid a really reasonable rate. I would tell anyone to stay at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Days Inn last month for a couple days while visiting my sister in the area. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. They offered a good breakfast and everything looked new throughout the motel. There was a hot tub that I used too. Other than they forgot to give me my wake up call, I liked this little inn.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: rae65
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was not very clean and the non-smoking room smelled of smoke and something else that is undescribable. Hotel seemed lax in security and was quite noisy. No microwave or indoor pool as touted by web site. Communication appeared to be a low priority as no one was able to answer such simple questions as "Is there a nearby park?" We had a reservation for 3 nights and checked out after the first night. Unfortunately the front desk staff failed to "check us out" and we were charged the full three days on our credit card despite paying cash upon surrendering the keys and notifying them of our departure. Subsequent attempts to handle this through the management have both failed and proved to be very frustrating. Had to contact the credit card company to dispute charges. Very unprofessional management/staff and a disappointing all-around experience. Check your credit card statement closely if you choose to stay at this hotel. The experience may do more than haunt you.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn South Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 13050 48th Ave South, Seattle, WA 98168
